text.__SUMMARY__: Conus wandae is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.These snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 20 mm and 33 mm. It is the morphotype of Africonus borgesi var. ervatao  Tenorio, M.J., C.M.L. Afonso, R.L. Cunha & E.M. Rolán, 2014.
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs in the Atlantic Ocean off Boa Vista Island, Cape Verde.
text.References:
Cossignani (2014), Malacologia Mostra Mondiale 82: 22-23
Puillandre, N.; Duda, T.F.; Meyer, C.; Olivera, B.M.; Bouchet, P. (2015). "One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails". Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1–23. doi:10.1093/mollus/eyu055. PMC 4541476.
